Config Object.name: initialList
desc: The initialList property is the first list started when the user clicks on the AutoComplete widget.
It's value should be the name of a List Object.
initialList is required when there are more than one List Objects on config.lists.

Config Object.name: initialValue
desc: If provided, sets the initial value of the AutoComplete widget.

Config Object.name: lists
desc: The lists property contains all of the lists used to power the dropdown options.
lists should be an object where the property values are the names of lists, and the values are List Objects.

Config Object.name: maxTokenGroups
desc: The maximum number of Token Groups allowed in the search bar.
Set maxTokenGroups to false to allow unlimited Token Groups.

Config Object.name: onChange
desc: Function to execute when the value of the widget changes.
The first argument to the function is the new value of the widget, the second argument is the old value of the widget.
If this function returns a valid widget value, then that value becomes the value of the widget.  If not, the original new value becomes the value of the widget.

Config Object.name: placeholderHTML
desc: A placeholder to show in the AutoComplete widget when there are no Token Groups.

Config Object.name: showErrors
desc: showErrors is an optional parameter to control how AutoComplete reports errors.
Every error in AutoComplete has a unique code to help diagnose problems and search for solutions.
If showErrors is false then errors will be ignored.
If showErrors is 'console' then errors will be sent to console.log().
If showErrors is 'alert' then errors will be sent to window.alert().
If showErrors is a function then the first argument is the unique error code, the second argument is an error string, and an optional third argument is a data structure that is relevant to the error.

Config Object.name: tokenSeparatorHTML
desc: The HTML string to put between Tokens in the search bar.
If tokenSeparatorHTML is a function the first argument is the Token Object to the left of the separator, the second argument is the Token Object to the right.
The function should return an HTML string.

Methods.name: clear()
desc: Removes all the pieces on the board with a fade effect.
Has the same effect as calling position({})

Methods.name: clear(useAnimation)
args: If false, removes pieces immediately
desc: Removes all the pieces on the board instantly.
Has the same effect as calling position({}, false)

Methods.name: destroy()
Methods.desc: Remove the widget from the DOM.

Methods.name: fen()
desc: Returns the current position as a FEN string.
Has the same effect as calling position('fen')

Methods.name: flip()
Methods.desc: Flips the orientation of the board.

Methods.name: move(move1, move2, etc)
desc: Executes one or more moves on the board.
Returns an updated Position Object of the board including the move(s).

Methods.name: position()
args: name of the list to get

Methods.name: position(newPosition)
args: name of the list to add or update
Methods.desc: Alias of setList(name, list)

Methods.name: orientation()
desc: Simulates the user pressing the "Down Arrow" key on the input field.
Has no effect if the input field does not have focus.

Methods.name: orientation(newOrientation)
desc: Simulates the user pressing the "Enter" key on the input field.
Has no effect if the input field does not have focus.

Methods.name: start()
desc: Sets the board to the start position.
Has the same effect as calling position('start')

Errors.desc: The first argument to ChessBoard() cannot be an empty string.
Errors.fix: The first argument to the ChessBoard() constructor should be the id of a DOM element or a reference to a single DOM element.

Errors.desc: Element with id "<id>" does not exist in the DOM.
fix: ChessBoard could not find your element with document.getElementById.
Please note that if you pass a string as the first argument to the ChessBoard() constructor it should be the value of a DOM id, not a CSS selector (ie: "board", not "#board").

Errors.desc: The first argument to ChessBoard() must be an ID or a single DOM node.
Errors.fix: The first argument to the ChessBoard() constructor should be the id of a DOM element or a reference to a single DOM element.

Errors.desc: JSON does not exist. Please include a JSON polyfill.
Errors.fix: ChessBoard requires a JSON implementation. Please include a polyfill for older browsers.

Errors.desc: Unable to find a valid version of jQuery. Please include jQuery 1.4.2 or higher on the page.
Errors.fix: ChessBoard requires jQuery version 1.4.2 or higher.

Errors.desc: Invalid move passed to the move method.
Errors.fix: Moves must be a string in the form of 'e2-e4', 'b8-c6', etc.

Errors.desc: Invalid value passed to the orientation method.
Errors.fix: The first argument to the orientation method must be 'white', 'black', or 'flip'.

Errors.desc: Invalid value passed to the position method.
Errors.fix: Position must be either 'start', a valid FEN String, or a valid Position Object.
Position must either be 'start', a valid FEN String, or a Position Object.
